abstracts.cdata!:
The proposed Project consists of a
            two-year segment of a railway rehabilitation program, which
            is part of CNR's investment plan for 1973-76, and of a
            Program of Action. The Project was first appraised by the
            Bank in 1971; the appraisal made it clear that the project
            execution would have to concentrate on (a) the ability of
            CNR's management to achieve the desirable operating
            targets and financial results (b) the need to reduce losses
            on, and ultimately close, certain uneconomic lines and (c)
            the need for continued substantial financial contributions
            from the Government to CNR. These issues were thoroughly
            considered by the Government and CNR who agreed in principle
            with the Bank on an appropriate course of action for dealing
            with them.
